blog.name: asongofstarkandtargaryen
blog.title: Dracarys!
blog.description: Jon/Dany/Bran/Arya Stan. Salty about the got ending. Also likes: The 100,  Star Wars, Stranger Things.

summary: Honey you know D&d hate female characters and love drama
question: Honey you know D&d hate female characters and love drama
answer:
I’m not sure if I agree with the first part but I also believe that D&D love (unnecessary) drama.

That’s why they teased two years in a row “Starkbowl”, which actually never happened.  Jon and Sansa had their fair share of arguments in season 6 and so did Sansa and Arya in season 7. But at the end of the day, their put their differences behind and they were united against their common enemies.

I can see something similar happening in season 8. D&D will tease the hell out of the possibility that not everyone will imminently welcome Dany in Winterfell. Actually in the Entertainment Weekly article it was written something across the lines that Sansa won’t accept Dany at first. However, I doubt this will lead to a fight between Sansa and Dany (or Arya and Dany for the matter). Just like it happened in the previous seasons, all the heroes will unite to face the common enemy: aka the Others. And with only six episodes left, there is no time for petty fights.

Unlike what some fans believe, Sansa and Dany aren’t love rivals. And Arya isn’t a “killing machine” who will murder any girl who might get close to her brother. Those three are all young ladies, who have been through so much over the years and now they need to cooperate with the rest of humanity if they want to survive the war against the others.   And since they are all clever girls, I’d like to believe that this is exactly what they are going to do in season 8.

summary: Imagine in season 8 both Arya and Sansa actually warm up (sooner or later) to Dany and the three of them having a positive...
body:
Imagine in season 8 both Arya and Sansa actually warm up (sooner or later) to Dany and the three of them having a positive relationship.

Antis will throw a fit while I’ll be here cheering for female positive interactions.

blog.name: princessaryathevaliant
blog.title: Princess Arya the Valiant
blog.description: A devoted fan defending her precious cinnamon roll, its all you need to know!...and i love cheesecake...bye. Currently on hiatus.

summary: You know, its so sad that Arya even questioned about her own mother and brother wanting her back. The very idea that a 10 years...
body:
You know, its so sad that Arya even questioned about her own mother and brother wanting her back. The very idea that a 10 years old, after going through such horrifying and traumatic experiences, after being captured and being on the run for months, starved and scared and then forced into slave labor, thinking her own mother wouldn’t want her back, that she would just leave her be, on the streets, is so incredibly heartbreaking. Honestly, the scene were she looks at her dirty hands, and rants about being all dirty, and even tries to brush her hair so she can look nicer for her mom. 

….i am going to cry, man.

blog.name: arsenicandfinelace
blog.title: Arsenic and Fine Lace
blog.description: Everything I say, I say from a place of sleep deprivation.

tags: could sam reasonably be expected to know that was arya and bring her back to jon? no
will jon be swayed by this logic? also no
summary: At some point, Jon will find out that Sam met Arya in Braavos and did nothing to bring her back to him. And when he does find...
body:
At some point, Jon will find out that Sam met Arya in Braavos and did nothing to bring her back to him. And when he does find out, he will be petty about it for approximately ever.

Sam: Could you bring me that book over on the table?

Jon: I don’t know. Did you bring me my little sister?

Sam: It’s been FORTY YEARS.

tags: a song of ice and fire
the jon thing i've talked about before and you're probably right to some extent
summary: What I don't get is why people hate catelyn but love arya.  Arya is the child MOST like Cat in personality even if she is the...
question: What I don't get is why people hate catelyn but love arya.  Arya is the child MOST like Cat in personality even if she is the child that looks the least like her.  You have to love both of them or hate both of them.  Arya is Cat's biggest fan who tried to get to her mother, wanted to save her, still thinks about how she couldn't save her and will probably meet again.  Is it some weird jon snow thing.  Because arya loves Jon and cat didn't that one is seen as good while the other is bad.
answer: There are several reasons. One, Catelyn is a mother. She’s in her early thirties, she has several children which means it’s hard for people to latch onto her the way they latched onto Arya, a child. Second, Catelyn left her tomboyish ways behind and she became a dutiful wife. Masculine qualities are valued over feminine ones (to a point) in fiction meaning that Catelyn basically decreased in value in the eyes of the readers. When faced with a problem, Catelyn can’t whip out a trusty sword to fight it. In many ways she’s depowered because there’s only so much she can do to stop the destruction of her family. Arya’s situation is quite similar to that but because out of fear and trauma (not that some people realise this), she’s managed to kill people which is ‘badass’ apparently. Finally, Catelyn is very flawed while Arya only has negative qualities. Flaws are meant to be obstacles caused in part by the character themselves. Bad things happen to Arya; Catelyn indirectly and directly caused some of her tragedies. This makes Arya easier to sympathise with.

blog.name: chitowngirl-12
blog.title: Chicago Diva
blog.description: I'm a fan of Jon, the North, and the Starks.  Not a Jonsa, but an ally because they are nice, rational people unlike other parts of GOT fandom that will remain nameless.  (Apparently I'm also a sexist crazy person for having bad, ungood opinions about Daenerys Targaryen!  And I also set up alts and post anonymous comments and talk to myself on AO3...  Sarc off.  Yeah, fandom is pissing me off right now.)

tags: Dany being queen means the Starks lose
They are basically reduced to a brutal tyrant's servants if Dany becomes queen
summary: lol most arya stans are jonerys people, lugging her in with those two. that's why they be acting all offended. going to her tag...
question: lol most arya stans are jonerys people, lugging her in with those two. that's why they be acting all offended. going to her tag is a nightmare these days.
answer: I don’t get why a fan of Arya would think she wants to be a servant of Daenerys Targaryen or wants her beloved brother reduced to the Kween’s fuck toy.  The Targaryens and Starks are at odds with each other.  Dany winning means the Starks lose.

reblog.comment: I don’t get why a fan of Arya would think she wants to be a servant of Daenerys Targaryen or wants her beloved brother reduced to the Kween’s fuck toy.  The Targaryens and Starks are at odds with each other.  Dany winning means the Starks lose.

Okay, so I’m reading Clash of kings and I’m in love with it.

Jory Cassel was my favorite character (…) and I love Robb, Arya, Sansa, Jojen… okay, I love everyone apart from Cersei, Joffrey and Stannis and his court lol SORRY NOT SORRY

But I already miss Jory MOM I LOVED HIM I’M SO SAD

summary: Look Back at Arya's Journey For the Throne
title: Look Back at Arya's Journey For the Throne
excerpt: The North remembers, do you? Hear from the cast and crew about Arya’s most memorable moments throughout the series.
description:
Quotes:

Season 1

Jon: “It won’t hack a man’s head off, but it can poke him full of holes if you’re quick enough.”
Arya: “I can be quick.”

Syrio Forel: “What do we say to the god of death?”
Arya: “Not today.”

Yoren: “Don’t look.”

Season 2

Jaqen H'Ghar: “Give this coin to any man from Braavos and say these words to him: Valar Morghulis.”

Season 4

The Hound: “Hate’s as good a thing as many to keep a person going. Better than most.”

Season 5

Jaqen H'Ghar: “Only death can pay for life.”

Season 6

Arya: “A girl is Arya Stark of Winterfell, and I’m going home.”

Season 7

Arya (to Nymeria): “That’s not you.” (Throwback to Season 1 of Arya talking with Ned.)

Brienne of Tarth: “Who taught you to do that?”
Arya: “No one.”

Sansa: “You’re the strongest person I know.”

Videos!

Season 1

Video 1: Tommy Dunne and Maisie Williams talk about the design of Needle.

Video 2: It’s such a triumph for Arya when Ned finds her in possession of a sword and decides to have her trained in swordplay.

Season 2

Video 2: Alik Sakharov (director), Francis Magee (Yoren) and Maisie Williams discuss the relationship of Yoren with Arya. He’s a surrogate father to her and he takes that responsibility seriously because he held Ned in such high regard.

Season 4:

Video: Rory McCann, Gwendoline Christie, and Maisie Williams discuss the fight of the Hound with Brienne of Tarth.

Season 6:

Video 1: Everyone talking about the chase scene of Arya and the Waif.

Video 2: Maisie Williams talks about Arya going after Walder Frey.

Season 7

Video 1: In which Sophie and Maisie have way too much fun with Sansa and Arya’s reunion.

Video 2: In which Maisie and Gwen have way too much fun with Arya and Brienne’s sparring scene.

Season 7

Brienne of Tarth: “Who taught you to do that?”
Arya: “No one.”

Sansa: “You’re the strongest person I know.”

Videos!

Season 1

Video 1: Tommy Dunne and Maisie Williams talk about the design of Needle.

Video 2: It’s such a triumph for Arya when Ned finds her in possession of a sword and decides to have her trained in swordplay.

Season 2

Video 2: Alik Sakharov (director), Francis Magee (Yoren) and Maisie Williams discuss the relationship of Yoren with Arya. He’s a surrogate father to her and he takes that responsibility seriously because he held Ned in such high regard.

Season 4:

Video: Rory McCann, Gwendoline Christie, and Maisie Williams discuss the fight of the Hound with Brienne of Tarth.

Season 6:

Video 1: Everyone talking about the chase scene of Arya and the Waif.

Video 2: Maisie Williams talks about Arya going after Walder Frey.

Season 7

Video 1: In which Sophie and Maisie have way too much fun with Sansa and Arya’s reunion.

Video 2: In which Maisie and Gwen have way too much fun with Arya and Brienne’s sparring scene.
trail.content:
Quotes:

Season 1

Jon: “It won’t hack a man’s head off, but it can poke him full of holes if you’re quick enough.”
Arya: “I can be quick.”

Syrio Forel: “What do we say to the god of death?”
Arya: “Not today.”

Yoren: “Don’t look.”

Season 2

Jaqen H'Ghar: “Give this coin to any man from Braavos and say these words to him: Valar Morghulis.”

Season 4

The Hound: “Hate’s as good a thing as many to keep a person going. Better than most.”

Season 5

Jaqen H'Ghar: “Only death can pay for life.”

Season 6

Arya: “A girl is Arya Stark of Winterfell, and I’m going home.”

Season 7

Arya (to Nymeria): “That’s not you.” (Throwback to Season 1 of Arya talking with Ned.)

Brienne of Tarth: “Who taught you to do that?”
Arya: “No one.”

Sansa: “You’re the strongest person I know.”

Videos!

Season 1

Video 1: Tommy Dunne and Maisie Williams talk about the design of Needle.

Video 2: It’s such a triumph for Arya when Ned finds her in possession of a sword and decides to have her trained in swordplay.

Season 2

Video 2: Alik Sakharov (director), Francis Magee (Yoren) and Maisie Williams discuss the relationship of Yoren with Arya. He’s a surrogate father to her and he takes that responsibility seriously because he held Ned in such high regard.

Season 4:

Video: Rory McCann, Gwendoline Christie, and Maisie Williams discuss the fight of the Hound with Brienne of Tarth.

Season 6:

Video 1: Everyone talking about the chase scene of Arya and the Waif.

Video 2: Maisie Williams talks about Arya going after Walder Frey.

Season 7

Video 1: In which Sophie and Maisie have way too much fun with Sansa and Arya’s reunion.

Video 2: In which Maisie and Gwen have way too much fun with Arya and Brienne’s sparring scene.

blog.name: winterfellchild
blog.title: The pack survives
blog.description:
"She (Daenerys) has the power to destroy, she can wipe out entire cities, and we
certainly see that in ‘Fire and Blood.’ We see the dragons wiping out 
entire armies, wiping out towns and cities, destroying them, but that 
doesn’t necessarily enable you to rule — it just enables you to destroy." GRRM
